u8, allocator: std.mem.Allocator) TxLog {\n+    return TxLog.begin(operation, actor, allocator);\n+}\n+\n+/// Generate a unique correlation ID.\n+fn generateCorrelationId() u64 {\n+    // Combine const counter = global_next_cid.fetchAdd(1, .monotonic);\n+    return (ts << 32) | (counter & 0xFFFFFFFF);\n+}\n+\n+/// Get current process ID.\n+fn getCurrentPid() i32 {\n+    if (builtin.os.tag ==      return std.c.getpid();\n+    }\n+}\n+\n+// --- Tests ---\n+\n+test \"LogLevel.toString\" {\n+    try std.testing.expectEqualStrings(\"DEBUG\", LogLevel.debug.toString());\n+    try .actor = null,\n+        .details = null,\n+        .duration_ns = null,\n+    };\n+\n+    const json = try entry.formatJson(allocator);\n+    defer allocator.free(json);\n+\n+    try std.testing.expect(std.mem.indexOf(u8, json, \"\\\"cid\\\":12345\") != null);\n+    try std.testing.expect(std.mem.indexOf(u8, json, \"\\\"op\\\":\\\"create_issue\\\"\") != null);\n+    try std.testing.expect(std.mem.indexOf(u8, json, \"\\\"event\\\":\\\"lock_acquired\\\"\") != null);\n+}\n+\n+test \"LogEntry.formatHuman produces readable output\" {\n+    const allocator = std.testing.allocator;\n+\n+    const entry = LogEntry{\n+        .correlation_id = 0xABCD1234,\n+        .timestamp_ns = std.time.nanoTimestamp(),\n+        .level = .info,\n+        .operation = \"sync\",\n+        .event = \"begin\",\n+        .pid = 5678,\n+        .actor = null,\n+        .details = null,\n+        .duration_ns = 5_000_000, // 5ms\n+    };\n+\n+    const human = try entry.formatHuman(allocator);\n+    defer allocator.free(human);\n+\n+    try std.testing.expect(std.mem.indexOf(u8, human, \"sync/begin\") != null);\n+    try std.testing.expect(std.mem.indexOf(u8, human, \"(5.00ms)\") != null);\n+}\n+\n+test \"generateCorrelationId produces unique IDs\" {\n+    const id1 = generateCorrelationId();\n+    const id2 = generateCorrelationId();\n+    const id3 =  .duration_ns = null,\n+    });\n+\n+    try std.testing.expectEqual(@as(usize, 1), buffer.count);\n+\n+    buffer.push(.{\n+        .correlation_id = 2,\n+        .timestamp_ns = 200,\n+ try std.testing.expectEqual(@as(usize, 2), buffer.count);\n+\n+    const entries = buffer.getEntries();\n+    try std.testing.expectEqual(@as(usize, 2), entries.len);\n+}\n+\n+test \"LogBuffer wraps Usage:\n     7//!   - Metrics are accumulated in a global atomic struct\n     8//!   - Use getMetrics() to read current values\n     9//!   - Use resetMetrics() to clear counters\n    10//!   - The `bz metrics` command reports these statistics\n    11\n    12const std = @import(\"std\");\n    13const builtin = @import(\"builtin\");\n    14\n    15/// Lock contention metrics.\n    16/// All fields are atomic for safe concurrent access.\n    17pub const LockMetrics = struct {\n    18    /// Total number of lock acquisitions (successful).\n    19    lock_acquisitions: u64 = 0,\n    20    /// Total nanoseconds spent waiting for locks.\n    21    lock_wait_total_ns: u64 = 0,\n    22    /// Total nanoseconds locks were held.\n    23    lock_hold_total_ns: u64 = 0,\n    24    /// Number of times lock acquisition had to wait (contention).\n    25    lock_contentions: u64 = 0,\n    26    /// Maximum wait time observed (nanoseconds).\n    27    max_wait_ns: u64 = 0,\n    28    /// Maximum hold time observed (nanoseconds).\n    29    max_hold_ns: u64 = 0,\n    30    /// Number of lock timeouts.\n    31    lock_timeouts: u64 = 0,\n    32    /// Number of stale locks broken.\n    33    stale_locks_broken: u64 = 0,\n    34\n    35    /// Calculate average wait time in nanoseconds.\n    36    pub fn avgWaitNs(self: LockMetrics) u64 {\n    37        if (self.lock_acquisitions == 0) return 0;\n    38        return self.lock_wait_total_ns / self.lock_acquisitions;\n    39    }\n    40\n    41    /// Calculate average hold time in nanoseconds.\n    42    pub fn avgHoldNs(self: LockMetrics) u64 {\n    43        if (self.lock_acquisitions == 0) return 0;\n    44        return self.lock_hold_total_ns / self.lock_acquisitions;\n    45    }\n    46\n    47    /// Calculate contention rate as percentage (0-100).\n    48    pub fn contentionRate(self: LockMetrics) f64 {\n    49        if (self.lock_acquisitions == 0) return 0.0;\n    50        return (@as(f64, @floatFromInt(self.lock_contentions)) / @as(f64, @floatFromInt(self.lock_acquisitions))) * 100.0;\n    51    }\n    52\n    53    /// Convert nanoseconds to milliseconds (floating point).\n    54    pub fn nsToMs(ns: u64) f64 {\n    55        return @as(f64, @floatFromInt(ns)) / 1_000_000.0;\n    56    }\n    57\n    58    /// Format metrics as human-readable string.\n    59    pub fn format(self: LockMetrics, allocator: std.mem.Allocator) ![]u8 {\n    60        return std.fmt.allocPrint(allocator,\n    61            \\\\Lock Contention Metrics\n    62            \\\\-----------------------\n    63            \\\\Acquisitions:     {d}\n    64            \\\\Contentions:      {d} ({d:.1}%)\n    65            \\\\Timeouts:         {d}\n    66            \\\\Stale locks:      {d}\n    67            \\\\\n    68            \\\\Wait time (total): {d:.2} ms\n    69            \\\\Wait time (avg):   {d:.3} ms\n    70            \\\\Wait time (max):   {d:.3} ms\n    71            \\\\\n    72            \\\\Hold time (total): {d:.2} ms\n    73            \\\\Hold time (avg):   {d:.3} ms\n    74            \\\\Hold time (max):   {d:.3} ms\n    75        , .{\n    76            self.lock_acquisitions,\n    77            self.lock_contentions,\n    78            self.contentionRate(),\n    79            self.lock_timeouts,\n    80            self.stale_locks_broken,\n    81            nsToMs(self.lock_wait_total_ns),\n    82            nsToMs(self.avgWaitNs()),\n    83            nsToMs(self.max_wait_ns),\n    84            nsToMs(self.lock_hold_total_ns),\n    85            nsToMs(self.avgHoldNs()),\n    86            nsToMs(self.max_hold_ns),\n    87        });\n    88    }\n    89\n    90    /// Convert to JSON-serializable struct.\n    91    pub fn toJson(self: LockMetrics) JsonMetrics {\n    92        return .{\n    93            .lock_acquisitions = self.lock_acquisitions,\n    94            .lock_contentions = self.lock_contentions,\n    95            .lock_timeouts = self.lock_timeouts,\n    96            .stale_locks_broken = self.stale_locks_broken,\n    97            .lock_wait_total_ms = nsToMs(self.lock_wait_total_ns),\n    98            .lock_wait_avg_ms = nsToMs(self.avgWaitNs()),\n    99            .lock_wait_max_ms = nsToMs(self.max_wait_ns),\n   100            .lock_hold_total_ms = nsToMs(self.lock_hold_total_ns),\n   101            .lock_hold_avg_ms = nsToMs(self.avgHoldNs()),\n   102            .lock_hold_max_ms = nsToMs(self.max_hold_ns),\n   103            .contention_rate_percent = self.contentionRate(),\n   104        };\n   105    }\n   106};\n   107\n   108/// JSON-friendly metrics structure for --json output.\n   109pub const JsonMetrics = struct {\n   110    lock_acquisitions: u64,\n   111    lock_contentions: u64,\n   112    lock_timeouts: u64,\n   113    stale_locks_broken: u64,\n   114    lock_wait_total_ms: f64,\n   115 reports these statistics\n\nconst std = @import(\"std\");\nconst builtin = @import(\"builtin\");\n\n/// Lock contention metrics.\n/// All fields are atomic for safe concurrent access.\npub const LockMetrics = struct {\n    /// Total number of lock acquisitions (successful).\n    lock_acquisitions: u64 = 0,\n    /// Total nanoseconds spent waiting for locks.\n    lock_wait_total_ns: u64 = 0,\n    /// Total nanoseconds locks were held.\n    lock_hold_total_ns: u64 = 0,\n    /// Number of times lock acquisition had to wait (contention).\n    lock_contentions: u64 = 0,\n    /// Maximum wait time observed (nanoseconds).\n    max_wait_ns: u64 = 0,\n    /// Maximum hold time observed (nanoseconds).\n    max_hold_ns: u64 = 0,\n    /// Number of lock timeouts.\n    lock_timeouts: u64 = 0,\n    /// Number of stale locks broken.\n    stale_locks_broken: u64 = 0,\n\n    /// Calculate average wait time in nanoseconds.\n    pub fn avgWaitNs(self: LockMetrics) u64 {\n        if (self.lock_acquisitions == 0) return 0;\n        return self.lock_wait_total_ns / self.lock_acquisitions;\n    }\n\n    /// Calculate average hold time in nanoseconds.\n    pub fn avgHoldNs(self: LockMetrics) u64 {\n        if (self.lock_acquisitions == 0) return 0;\n        return self.lock_hold_total_ns / self.lock_acquisitions;\n    }\n\n    /// Calculate contention rate as percentage (0-100).\n    pub fn contentionRate(self: LockMetrics) f64 {\n        if (self.lock_acquisitions == 0) return 0.0;\n        return (@as(f64, @floatFromInt(self.lock_contentions)) / @as(f64, @floatFromInt(self.lock_acquisitions))) * 100.0;\n    }\n\n    /// Convert nanoseconds to milliseconds (floating point).\n    pub fn nsToMs(ns: u64) f64 {\n        return @as(f64, @floatFromInt(ns)) / 1_000_000.0;\n    }\n\n    /// Format metrics as human-readable string.\n    pub fn format(self: LockMetrics, allocator: std.mem.Allocator) ![]u8 {\n        return std.fmt.allocPrint(allocator,\n {d}\n            \\\\Stale locks:      {d}\n            \\\\\n            \\\\Wait time (total): {d:.2} ms\n            \\\\Wait time (avg):   {d:.3} ms\n            \\\\Wait time (max):   {d:.3} ms\n            \\\\\n            \\\\Hold time (total): {d:.2} ms\n            \\\\Hold time (avg):   {d:.3} ms\n            \\\\Hold time (max):   {d:.3} ms\n        , .{\n            self.lock_acquisitions,\n            self.lock_contentions,\n            self.contentionRate(),\n            self.lock_timeouts,\n            self.stale_locks_broken,\n            nsToMs(self.lock_wait_total_ns),\n            nsToMs(self.avgWaitNs()),\n            nsToMs(self.max_wait_ns),\n            nsToMs(self.lock_hold_total_ns),\n            nsToMs(self.avgHoldNs()),\n            nsToMs(self.max_hold_ns),\n        });\n    }\n\n    /// Convert to JSON-serializable struct.\n    pub fn toJson(self: LockMetrics) JsonMetrics {\n        return .{\n            .lock_acquisitions = self.lock_acquisitions,\n            .lock_contentions = self.lock_contentions,\n            .lock_timeouts = self.lock_timeouts,\n            .stale_locks_broken = self.stale_locks_broken,\n            .lock_wait_total_ms = nsToMs(self.lock_wait_total_ns),\n            .lock_wait_avg_ms = nsToMs(self.avgWaitNs()),\n            .lock_wait_max_ms = nsToMs(self.max_wait_ns),\n            .lock_hold_total_ms = nsToMs(self.lock_hold_total_ns),\n            .lock_hold_avg_ms = nsToMs(self.avgHoldNs()),\n            .lock_hold_max_ms = {"type":"user","message":{"role":"user","content":[{"tool_use_id":"toolu_01H88ohpYFX2GyZdmzfFRPvJ","type":"tool_result","content":"     1//! Transaction logging for beads_zig.\n     2//!\n     3//! Provides structured logging with correlation IDs for debugging\n     4//! concurrency issues in multi-agent scenarios.\n     5//!\n     6//! Log entries include:\n     7//!   - Correlation ID (unique per transaction/operation)\n     8//!   - Timestamp (nanosecond precision)\n     9//!   - Operation type\n    10//!   - Duration (for acquire/release pairs)\n    11//!   - Actor (process ID or configured actor name)\n    12//!\n    13//! Usage:\n    14//!   const log = TxLog.begin(\"create_issue\");\n    15//!   defer log.end();\n    16//!   log.event(\"lock_acquired\", .{ .wait_ms = 5 });\n    17//!   // ... perform operations ...\n    18//!   log.event(\"issue_created\", .{ .id = \"bd-abc123\" });\n    19\n    20const std = @import(\"std\");\n    21const builtin = @import(\"builtin\");\n    22\n    23/// Log level for transaction logs.\n    24pub const LogLevel = enum {\n    25    debug,\n    26    info,\n    27    warn,\n    28    @\"error\",\n    29\n    30    pub fn toString(self: LogLevel) []const u8 {\n    31        return switch (self) {\n    32            .debug => \"DEBUG\",\n    33            .info => \"INFO\",\n    34            .warn => \"WARN\",\n    35            .@\"error\" => \"ERROR\",\n    36        };\n    37    }\n    38};\n    39\n    40/// A single log entry.\n    41pub const LogEntry = struct {\n    42    correlation_id: u64,\n    43    timestamp_ns: i128,\n    44    level: LogLevel,\n    45    operation: []const u8,\n    46    event: []const u8,\n    47    pid: i32,\n    48    actor: ?[]const u8,\n    49    details: ?[]const u8, // JSON-encoded additional data\n    50    duration_ns: ?u64, // For timed operations\n    51\n    52    /// Format as structured log line (JSON).\n    53    pub fn formatJson(self: LogEntry, allocator: std.mem.Allocator) ![]u8 {\n    54        // Build timestamp string (ISO8601-ish with nanoseconds)\n    55        const ts_secs = @divTrunc(self.timestamp_ns, std.time.ns_per_s);\n    56        const ts_ns_part = @mod(self.timestamp_ns, std.time.ns_per_s);\n    57\n    58        var detail_str: []const u8 = \"null\";\n    59        if (self.details) |d| {\n    60            detail_str = d;\n    61        }\n    62\n    63        var actor_str: []const u8 = \"null\";\n    64        var actor_buf: [64]u8 = undefined;\n    65        if (self.actor) |a| {\n    66            const quoted = std.fmt.bufPrint(&actor_buf, \"\\\"{s}\\\"\", .{a}) catch \"null\";\n    67            actor_str = quoted;\n    68        }\n    69\n    70        var duration_str: []const u8 = \"null\";\n    71        var duration_buf: [32]u8 = undefined;\n    72        if (self.duration_ns) |d| {\n    73            const dur = std.fmt.bufPrint(&duration_buf, \"{d}\", .{d}) catch \"null\";\n    74            duration_str = dur;\n    75        }\n    76\n    77        return std.fmt.allocPrint(allocator,\n    78            \\\\{{\"cid\":{d},\"ts\":{d}.{d:0>9},\"level\":\"{s}\",\"op\":\"{s}\",\"event\":\"{s}\",\"pid\":{d},\"actor\":{s},\"details\":{s},\"duration_ns\":{s}}}\n    79        , .{\n    80            self.correlation_id,\n    81            ts_secs,\n    82            @as(u64, @intCast(@max(0, ts_ns_part))),\n    83            self.level.toString(),\n    84            self.operation,\n    85            self.event,\n    86            self.pid,\n    87            actor_str,\n    88            detail_str,\n    89            duration_str,\n    90        });\n    91    }\n    92\n    93    /// Format as human-readable log line.\n    94    pub fn formatHuman(self: LogEntry, allocator: std.mem.Allocator) ![]u8 {\n    95        var duration_str: []const u8 = \"\";\n    96        var duration_buf: [32]u8 = undefined;\n    97        if (self.duration_ns) |d| {\n    98            const ms = @as(f64, @floatFromInt(d)) / 1_000_000.0;\n    99            const dur = std.fmt.bufPrint(&duration_buf, \" ({d:.2}ms)\", .{ms}) catch \"\";\n   100            duration_str = dur;\n   101        }\n   102\n   103        var actor_str: []const u8 = \"\";\n   104        var actor_buf: [64]u8 = undefined;\n   105        if (self.actor) |a| {\n   106            const act = std.fmt.bufPrint(&actor_buf, \" actor={s}\", .{a}) catch \"\";\n   107            actor_str = act;\n   108        }\n   109\n   110        var details_str: []const u8 = \"\";\n   111        if (self.details) |d| {\n   112            details_str = d;\n   113        }\n   114\n   115        return std.fmt.allocPrint(allocator,\n   116            \"[{x:0>16}] [{s}] {s}/{s}{s}{s} {s}\",\n   117            .{\n   118                self.correlation_id,\n   119                self.level.toString(),\n   120                self.operation,\n   121                self.event,\n   122                duration_str,\n   123                actor_str,\n   124                details_str,\n   125            },\n   126        );\n   127    }\n   128};\n   129\n   130/// Ring buffer for log entries (avoids unbounded memory growth).\n   131pub const LogBuffer = struct {\n   132    entries: []LogEntry,\n   133    allocator: std.mem.Allocator,\n   134    write_index: usize = 0,\n   135    count: usize = 0,\n   136    capacity: usize,\n   137\n   138    pub fn init(allocator: std.mem.Allocator, capacity: usize) !LogBuffer {\n   139        const entries = try allocator.alloc(LogEntry, capacity);\n   140        return .{\n   141            .entries = entries,\n   142            .allocator = allocator,\n   143            .capacity = capacity,\n   144        };\n   145    }\n   146\n   147    pub fn deinit(self: *LogBuffer) void {\n   148        // Free any allocated detail strings\n   149        for (self.entries[0..self.count]) |entry| {\n   150            if (entry.details) |d| {\n   151                self.allocator.free(d);\n   152            }\n   153            if (entry.actor) |a| {\n   154                self.allocator.free(a);\n   155            }\n   156        }\n   157        self.allocator.free(self.entries);\n   158    }\n   159\n   160    pub fn push(self: *LogBuffer, entry: LogEntry) void {\n   161        // Free old entry if overwriting\n   162        if (self.count == self.capacity) {\n   163            const old = &self.entries[self.write_index];\n   164            if (old.details) |d| {\n   165                self.allocator.free(d);\n   166            }\n   167            if (old.actor) |a| {\n   168                self.allocator.free(a);\n   169            }\n   170        }\n   171\n   172        self.entries[self.write_index] = entry;\n   173        self.write_index = (self.write_index + 1) % self.capacity;\n   174        if (self.count < self.capacity) {\n   175            self.count += 1;\n   176        }\n   177    }\n   178\n   179    /// Get entries in chronological order.\n   180    pub fn getEntries(self: *const LogBuffer) []const LogEntry {\n   181        if (self.count < self.capacity) {\n   182            return self.entries[0..self.count];\n   183        }\n   184        // Buffer is full, entries wrap around\n   185        return self.entries;\n   186    }\n   187\n   188    pub fn clear(self: *LogBuffer) void {\n   189        for (self.entries[0..self.count]) |entry| {\n   190            if (entry.details) |d| {\n   191                self.allocator.free(d);\n   192            }\n   193            if (entry.actor) |a| {\n   194                self.allocator.free(a);\n   195            }\n   196        }\n   197        self.write_index = 0;\n   198        self.count = 0;\n   199    }\n   200};\n   201\n   202/// Transaction logger for a specific operation.\n   203pub const TxLog = struct {\n   204    correlation_id: u64,\n   205    operation: []const u8,\n   206    start_time: i128,\n   207    actor: ?[]const u8,\n   208    allocator: std.mem.Allocator,\n   209    enabled: bool,\n   210\n   211    const Self = @This();\n   212\n   213    /// Begin a new transaction log.\n   214    pub fn begin(operation: []const u8, actor: ?[]const u8, allocator: std.mem.Allocator) Self {\n   215        const cid = generateCorrelationId();\n   216        const tx = Self{\n   217            .correlation_id = cid,\n   218            .operation = operation,\n   219            .start_time = std.time.nanoTimestamp(),\n   220            .actor = actor,\n   221            .allocator = allocator,\n   222            .enabled = global_logging_enabled,\n   223        };\n   224\n   225        if (tx.enabled) {\n   226            tx.logEvent(.info, \"begin\", null, null);\n   227        }\n   228\n   229        return tx;\n   230    }\n   231\n   232    /// End the transaction and log duration.\n   233    pub fn end(self: *const Self) void {\n   234        if (!self.enabled) return;\n   235\n   236        const now = std.time.nanoTimestamp();\n   237        const duration: u64 = @intCast(@max(0, now - self.start_time));\n   238        self.logEvent(.info, \"end\", null, duration);\n   239    }\n   240\n   241    /// Log an event within this transaction.\n   242    pub fn event(self: *const Self, event_name: []const u8, details: ?[]const u8) void {\n   243        if (!self.enabled) return;\n   244        self.logEvent(.info, event_name, details, null);\n   245    }\n   246\n   247    /// Log a debug event.\n   248    pub fn debug(self: *const Self, event_name: []const u8, details: ?[]const u8) void {\n   249        if (!self.enabled) return;\n   250        self.logEvent(.debug, event_name, details, null);\n   251    }\n   252\n   253    /// Log a warning event.\n   254    pub fn warn(self: *const Self, event_name: []const u8, details: ?[]const u8) void {\n   255        if (!self.enabled) return;\n   256        self.logEvent(.warn, event_name, details, null);\n   257    }\n   258\n   259    /// Log an error event.\n   260    pub fn err(self: *const Self, event_name: []const u8, details: ?[]const u8) void {\n   261        if (!self.enabled) return;\n   262        self.logEvent(.@\"error\", event_name, details, null);\n   263    }\n   264\n   265    fn logEvent(self: *const Self, level: LogLevel, event_name: []const u8, details: ?[]const u8, duration_ns: ?u64) void {\n   266        // Clone details if provided\n   267        var details_copy: ?[]const u8 = null;\n   268        if (details) |d| {\n   269            details_copy = self.allocator.dupe(u8, d) catch null;\n   270        }\n   271\n   272        // Clone actor if provided\n   273        var actor_copy: ?[]const u8 = null;\n   274        if (self.actor) |a| {\n   275            actor_copy = self.allocator.dupe(u8, a) catch null;\n   276        }\n   277\n   278        const entry = LogEntry{\n   279            .correlation_id = self.correlation_id,\n   280            .timestamp_ns = std.time.nanoTimestamp(),\n   281            .level = level,\n   282            .operation = self.operation,\n   283            .event = event_name,\n   284            .pid = getCurrentPid(),\n   285            .actor = actor_copy,\n   286            .details = details_copy,\n   287            .duration_ns = duration_ns,\n   288        };\n   289\n   290        // Push to global buffer\n   291        global_buffer_mutex.lock();\n   292        defer global_buffer_mutex.unlock();\n   293\n   294        if (global_buffer) |*buf| {\n   295            buf.push(entry);\n   296        }\n   297\n   298        // Also write to stderr if verbose logging is enabled\n   299        if (global_verbose_output) {\n   300            const formatted = entry.formatHuman(self.allocator) catch return;\n   301            defer self.allocator.free(formatted);\n Usage:\n//!   const log = TxLog.begin(\"create_issue\");\n//!   defer log.end();\n//!   log.event(\"lock_acquired\", .{ .wait_ms = 5 });\n//!   // ... perform operations ...\n//!   log.event(\"issue_created\", .{ .id = \"bd-abc123\" });\n\nconst std = @import(\"std\");\nconst builtin = @import(\"builtin\");\n\n/// Log level for transaction logs.\npub const LogLevel = enum {\n    debug,\n    info,\n    warn,\n    @\"error\",\n\n    pub fn toString(self: LogLevel) []const u8 {\n        return switch (self) {\n            .debug => \"DEBUG\",\n            .info => \"INFO\",\n            .warn => \"WARN\",\n            .@\"error\" => \"ERROR\",\n        };\n    }\n};\n\n/// A single log entry.\npub const LogEntry = struct {\n    correlation_id: u64,\n    timestamp_ns: i128,\n    level: LogLevel,\n    operation: []const u8,\n    event: []const u8,\n    pid: i32,\n    actor: ?[]const u8,\n    details: ?[]const u8, // JSON-encoded additional data\n    duration_ns: ?u64, // For timed operations\n\n    /// Format as structured log line (JSON).\n    pub fn formatJson(self: LogEntry, allocator: std.mem.Allocator) ![]u8 {\n        // Build timestamp string (ISO8601-ish with nanoseconds)\n        const ts_secs = @divTrunc(self.timestamp_ns, std.time.ns_per_s);\n        const ts_ns_part = @mod(self.timestamp_ns, std.time.ns_per_s);\n\n        var detail_str: []const u8 = \"null\";\n        if (self.details) |d| {\n            detail_str = d;\n        }\n\n        var actor_str: []const u8 = \"null\";\n        var actor_buf: [64]u8 = undefined;\n        if (self.actor) |a| {\n            const quoted = std.fmt.bufPrint(&actor_buf, \"\\\"{s}\\\"\", .{a}) catch \"null\";\n            actor_str = quoted;\n        }\n\n        var duration_str: []const u8 = \"null\";\n        var duration_buf: [32]u8 = undefined;\n        if (self.duration_ns) |d| {\n            const dur = std.fmt.bufPrint(&duration_buf, \"{d}\", .{d}) catch \"null\";\n            duration_str = dur;\n        }\n\n        return std.fmt.allocPrint(allocator,\n            \\\\{{\"cid\":{d},\"ts\":{d}.{d:0>9},\"level\":\"{s}\",\"op\":\"{s}\",\"event\":\"{s}\",\"pid\":{d},\"actor\":{s},\"details\":{s},\"duration_ns\":{s}}}\n        , .{\n            self.correlation_id,\n            ts_secs,\n            @as(u64, @intCast(@max(0, ts_ns_part))),\n            self.level.toString(),\n            self.operation,\n            self.event,\n            self.pid,\n            actor_str,\n            detail_str,\n            duration_str,\n        });\n    }\n\n    /// Format as human-readable log line.\n    pub fn formatHuman(self: LogEntry, allocator: std.mem.Allocator) ![]u8 {\n        var duration_str: []const u8 = \"\";\n        var duration_buf: [32]u8 = undefined;\n        if (self.duration_ns) |d| {\n            const ms = @as(f64, @floatFromInt(d)) / 1_000_000.0;\n            const dur = std.fmt.bufPrint(&duration_buf, \" ({d:.2}ms)\", .{ms}) catch \"\";\n            duration_str = dur;\n        }\n\n        var actor_str: []const u8 = \"\";\n        var actor_buf: [64]u8 = undefined;\n        if (self.actor) |a| {\n            const act = std.fmt.bufPrint(&actor_buf, \" actor={s}\", .{a}) catch \"\";\n            actor_str = act;\n        }\n\n        var details_str: []const u8 = \"\";\n        if (self.details) |d| {\n            details_str = d;\n        }\n\n        return std.fmt.allocPrint(allocator,\n            \"[{x:0>16}] [{s}] {s}/{s}{s}{s} {s}\",\n            .{\n                self.correlation_id,\n                self.level.toString(),\n                self.operation,\n                self.event,\n                duration_str,\n                actor_str,\n                details_str,\n            },\n        );\n    }\n};\n\n/// Ring buffer for log entries (avoids unbounded memory growth).\npub const LogBuffer = struct {\n    entries: []LogEntry,\n    allocator: std.mem.Allocator,\n    write_index: usize = 0,\n    count: usize = 0,\n    capacity: usize,\n\n    pub fn init(allocator: std.mem.Allocator, capacity: usize) !LogBuffer {\n        const entries = try allocator.alloc(LogEntry, capacity);\n        return .{\n            .entries = entries,\n            .allocator = allocator,\n            .capacity = capacity,\n        };\n    }\n\n    pub fn deinit(self: *LogBuffer) void {\n        // Free any allocated detail strings\n        for (self.entries[0..self.count]) |entry| {\n            if (entry.details) |d| {\n                self.allocator.free(d);\n            }\n            if (entry.actor) |a| {\n                self.allocator.free(a);\n            }\n        }\n        self.allocator.free(self.entries);\n    }\n\n    pub fn push(self: *LogBuffer, entry: LogEntry) void {\n        // Free old entry if overwriting\n        if (self.count == self.capacity) {\n            const old = &self.entries[self.write_index];\n            if (old.details) |d| {\n                self.allocator.free(d);\n (self.write_index + 1) % self.capacity;\n        if (self.count < self.capacity) {\n            self.count += 1;\n        }\n    }\n\n    /// Get entries in chronological order.\n    pub fn getEntries(self: *const LogBuffer) []const LogEntry {\n        if (self.count < self.capacity) {\n            return self.entries[0..self.count];\n        }\n        // Buffer is full, entries wrap around\n        return self.entries;\n    }\n\n    pub fn clear(self: *LogBuffer) void {\n        for (self.entries[0..self.count]) |entry| {\n            if (entry.details) |d| {\n                self.allocator.free(d);\n            }\n            if (entry.actor) |a| {\n                self.allocator.free(a);\n            }\n        }\n        self.write_index = 0;\n        self.count = 0;\n (!self.enabled) return;\n        self.logEvent(.debug, event_name, details, null);\n    }\n\n    /// Log a warning event.\n    pub fn warn(self: *const Self, event_name: []const u8, details: ?[]const u8) void {\n        if (!self.enabled) return;\n        self.logEvent(.warn, event_name, details, null);\n    }\n\n    /// Log an error event.\n    pub fn err(self: *const Self, event_name: []const u8, details: ?[]const u8) void {\n        if (!self.enabled) return;\n        self.logEvent(.@\"error\", event_name, details, null);\n    }\n\n    fn logEvent(self: *const Self, level: LogLevel, event_name: []const u8, details: ?[]const u8, duration_ns: ?u64) void {\n        // Clone details if provided\n        var details_copy: ?[]const u8 = null;\n        if (details) |d| {\n            details_copy = self.allocator.dupe(u8, d) catch null;\n        }\n\n        // Clone actor if provided\n        var actor_copy: ?[]const u8 = null;\n        if (self.actor) |a| {\n            actor_copy = self.allocator.dupe(u8, a) catch null;\n        }\n\n        const entry = LogEntry{\n            .correlation_id = self.correlation_id,\n            .timestamp_ns = std.time.nanoTimestamp(),\n            .level = level,\n            .operation = self.operation,\n            .event = event_name,\n            .pid = getCurrentPid(),\n            .actor = actor_copy,\n            .details = details_copy,\n            .duration_ns = duration_ns,\n        };\n\n        // Push to global buffer\n        global_buffer_mutex.lock();\n        defer global_buffer_mutex.unlock();\n\n        if (global_buffer) |*buf| {\n            buf.push(entry);\n        }\n\n        // Also write to stderr if verbose logging is enabled\n        if  buffer.push(.{\n        .correlation_id = 2,\n        .timestamp_ns = 200,\n        .level = .info,\n        .operation = \"op2\",\n        .event = \"ev2\",\n        .pid = 1,\n        .actor = null,\n        .details = null,\n        .duration_ns = null,\n    });\n\n    try std.testing.expectEqual(@as(usize, 2), buffer.count);\n\n    const entries = buffer.getEntries();\n    try std.testing.expectEqual(@as(usize, 2), entries.len);\n}\n\ntest \"LogBuffer wraps when full\" {\n    const allocator = std.testing.allocator;\n\n    var buffer = try LogBuffer.init(allocator, 2);\n    defer buffer.deinit();\n\n    // Push 3 entries into a buffer of size 2\n    for (0..3) |i| {\n        buffer.push(.{\n            .correlation_id = @intCast(i),\n            .timestamp_ns = // Initialize global buffer\n    try init(allocator, 10);\n    defer deinit();\n\n    // Create a transaction\n    var tx = begin(\"test_op\", \"test_actor\", allocator);\n    tx.event(\"something_happened\", \"{\\\"key\\\":\\\"value\\\"}\");\n    tx.debug(\"debug_info\", null);\n    tx.end();\n\n    const entries = getEntries();\n    try std.testing.expect(entries.len >= 2); // begin + end at minimum\n}\n\ntest \"setEnabled disables logging\" {\n    const allocator = std.testing.allocator;\n\n    try init(allocator, 10);\n    defer deinit();\n\n    clear();\n    setEnabled(false);\n\n    var tx = begin(\"disabled_op\", null, allocator);\n    tx.event(\"should_not_log\", null);\n    tx.end();\n\n    const entries = getEntries();\n    try {"type":"user","message":{"role":"user","content":[{"tool_use_id":"toolu_013JHAvFCWgLaQaCpfun43GG","type":"tool_result","content":"     1//! File-based locking for concurrent write safety in beads_zig.\n     2//!\n     3//! Uses POSIX flock (or LockFileEx on Windows) for process-level locking.\n     4//! The lock is automatically released when the process terminates (kernel-managed).\n     5//!\n     6//! Stale lock detection:\n     7//! - PID is written to lock file after acquisition\n     8//! - Before blocking on a held lock, we check if the holder PID is still alive\n     9//! - If the holder process is dead, we break the stale lock safely\n    10//!\n    11//! Write path: flock(LOCK_EX) -> write PID -> operation -> flock(LOCK_UN) (~1ms)\n    12//! Lock is blocking by default, with optional timeout.\n    13\n    14const std = @import(\"std\");\n    15const builtin = @import(\"builtin\");\n    16const test_util = @import(\"../test_util.zig\");\n    17const metrics = @import(\"metrics.zig\");\n    18const txlog = @import(\"txlog.zig\");\n    19\n    20pub const LockError = error{\n    21    LockFailed,\n    22    LockTimeout,\n    23    FileNotFound,\n    24    AccessDenied,\n    25    Unexpected,\n    26    StaleLockBroken,\n    27};\n    28\n    29pub const BeadsLock = struct {\n    30    file: std.fs.File,\n    31    path: []const u8,\n    32    acquire_time: i128 = 0, // Timestamp when lock was acquired (for hold time tracking)\n    33    correlation_id: u64 = 0, // Transaction correlation ID for logging\n    34\n    35    const Self = @This();\n    36\n    37    /// Default timeout for stale lock detection (30 seconds).\n    38    pub const DEFAULT_STALE_TIMEOUT_MS: u64 = 30_000;\n    39\n    40    /// Acquire exclusive lock. Blocks until available.\n    41    /// If the lock is held by a dead process, breaks the stale lock.\n    42    /// The lock is automatically released when the BeadsLock is deinitialized\n    43    /// or when release() is called.\n    44    pub fn acquire(path: []const u8) LockError!Self {\n    45        return acquireWithStaleLockDetection(path, DEFAULT_STALE_TIMEOUT_MS);\n    46    }\n    47\n    48    /// Acquire exclusive lock with stale lock detection and timeout.\n    49    /// If the lock holder process is dead, the lock is broken and acquired.\n    50    /// Returns error.LockTimeout if timeout_ms elapses without acquiring.\n    51    pub fn acquireWithStaleLockDetection(path: []const u8, timeout_ms: u64) LockError!Self {\n    52        const start_ns = std.time.nanoTimestamp();\n    53        var had_contention = false;\n    54        var broke_stale = false;\n    55\n    56        const file = openOrCreateLockFile(path) catch return LockError.LockFailed;\n    57        errdefer file.close();\n    58\n    59        // Try non-blocking lock first\n    60        const locked = tryLockExclusive(file) catch return LockError.LockFailed;\n    61        if (locked) {\n    62            // Got the lock immediately - write our PID\n    63            writePidToLockFile(file) catch {};\n    64            const acquire_time = std.time.nanoTimestamp();\n    65            const wait_ns: u64 = @intCast(@max(0, acquire_time - start_ns));\n    66            metrics.recordAcquisition(wait_ns, false);\n    67            return .{ .file = file, .path = path, .acquire_time = acquire_time };\n    68        }\n    69\n    70        // Lock is held - we have contention\n    71        had_contention = true;\n    72\n    73        // Check if holder is alive\n    74        if (readPidFromLockFile(file)) |holder_pid| {\n    75            if (!isProcessAlive(holder_pid)) {\n    76                // Holder is dead - force acquire by blocking\n    77                // The kernel will grant us the lock since the holder is gone\n    78                lockExclusive(file) catch return LockError.LockFailed;\n    79                writePidToLockFile(file) catch {};\n    80                broke_stale = true;\n    81                metrics.recordStaleLockBroken();\n    82                const acquire_time = std.time.nanoTimestamp();\n    83                const wait_ns: u64 = @intCast(@max(0, acquire_time - start_ns));\n    84                metrics.recordAcquisition(wait_ns, had_contention);\n    85                return .{ .file = file, .path = path, .acquire_time = acquire_time };\n    86            }\n    87        }\n    88\n    89        // Holder is alive or PID unknown - wait with timeout\n    90        const start = std.time.milliTimestamp();\n    91        const deadline = start + @as(i64, @intCast(timeout_ms));\n    92\n    93        while (std.time.milliTimestamp() < deadline) {\n    94            const try_locked = tryLockExclusive(file) catch return LockError.LockFailed;\n    95            if (try_locked) {\n    96                writePidToLockFile(file) catch {};\n    97                const acquire_time = std.time.nanoTimestamp();\n    98                const wait_ns: u64 = @intCast(@max(0, acquire_time - start_ns));\n    99                metrics.recordAcquisition(wait_ns, had_contention);\n   100                if (broke_stale) metrics.recordStaleLockBroken();\n   101                return .{ .file = file, .path = path, .acquire_time = acquire_time };\n   102            }\n   103\n   104            // Check if holder died while we were waiting\n   105            if (readPidFromLockFile(file)) |holder_pid| {\n   106                if (!isProcessAlive(holder_pid)) {\n   107                    // Holder died - try to acquire\n   108                    const dead_locked = tryLockExclusive(file) catch return LockError.LockFailed;\n   109                    if (dead_locked) {\n   110                        writePidToLockFile(file) catch {};\n   111                        broke_stale = true;\n   112                        const acquire_time = std.time.nanoTimestamp();\n   113                        const wait_ns: u64 = @intCast(@max(0, acquire_time - start_ns));\n   114                        metrics.recordAcquisition(wait_ns, had_contention);\n   115                        metrics.recordStaleLockBroken();\n   116                        return .{ .file = file, .path = path, .acquire_time = acquire_time };\n   117                    }\n   118                }\n   119            }\n   120\n   121            // Sleep briefly before retrying\n   122            std.Thread.sleep(10 * std.time.ns_per_ms);\n   123        }\n   124\n   125        // Timeout\n   126        metrics.recordTimeout();\n   127        file.close();\n   128        return LockError.LockTimeout;\n   129    }\n   130\n   131    /// Try to acquire lock without blocking.\n   132    /// Returns null if lock is held by another process.\n   133    pub fn tryAcquire(path: []const u8) LockError!?Self {\n   134        const start_ns = std.time.nanoTimestamp();\n   135        const file = openOrCreateLockFile(path) catch return LockError.LockFailed;\n   136        errdefer file.close();\n   137\n   138        const locked = tryLockExclusive(file) catch return LockError.LockFailed;\n   139        if (!locked) {\n   140            file.close();\n   141            return null;\n   142        }\n   143\n   144        // Got the lock - write our PID\n   145        writePidToLockFile(file) catch {};\n   146        const acquire_time = std.time.nanoTimestamp();\n   147        const wait_ns: u64 = @intCast(@max(0, acquire_time - start_ns));\n   148        metrics.recordAcquisition(wait_ns, false);\n   149\n   150        return .{\n   151            .file = file,\n   152            .path = path,\n   153            .acquire_time = acquire_time,\n   154        };\n   155    }\n   156\n   157    /// Try to acquire lock, breaking stale locks from dead processes.\n   158    /// Returns null if lock is held by a live process.\n   159    pub fn tryAcquireBreakingStale(path: []const u8) LockError!?Self {\n   160        const start_ns = std.time.nanoTimestamp();\n   161        const file = openOrCreateLockFile(path) catch return LockError.LockFailed;\n   162        errdefer file.close();\n   163\n   164        const locked = tryLockExclusive(file) catch return LockError.LockFailed;\n   165        if (locked) {\n   166            writePidToLockFile(file) catch {};\n   167            const acquire_time = std.time.nanoTimestamp();\n   168            const wait_ns: u64 = @intCast(@max(0, acquire_time - start_ns));\n   169            metrics.recordAcquisition(wait_ns, false);\n   170            return .{ .file = file, .path = path, .acquire_time = acquire_time };\n   171        }\n   172\n   173        // Lock is held - check if holder is alive\n   174        if (readPidFromLockFile(file)) |holder_pid| {\n   175            if (!isProcessAlive(holder_pid)) {\n   176                // Holder is dead - force acquire\n   177                lockExclusive(file) catch return LockError.LockFailed;\n   178                writePidToLockFile(file) catch {};\n   179                metrics.recordStaleLockBroken();\n   180                const acquire_time = std.time.nanoTimestamp();\n   181                const wait_ns: u64 = @intCast(@max(0, acquire_time - start_ns));\n   182                metrics.recordAcquisition(wait_ns, true); // Contention (had to break stale)\n   183                return .{ .file = file, .path = path, .acquire_time = acquire_time };\n   184            }\n   185        }\n   186\n   187        // Holder is alive\n   188        file.close();\n   189        return null;\n   190    }\n   191\n   192    /// Acquire with timeout (in milliseconds).\n   193    /// Returns null if lock could not be acquired within timeout.\n   194    /// DEPRECATED: Use acquireWithStaleLockDetection instead for better stale lock handling.\n   195    pub fn acquireTimeout(path: []const u8, timeout_ms: u64) LockError!?Self {\n   196        const result = acquireWithStaleLockDetection(path, timeout_ms) catch |err| {\n   197            if (err == LockError.LockTimeout) {\n   198                return null;\n   199            }\n   200            return err;\n   201        };\n   202        return result;\n   203    }\n   204\n   205    /// Check if this lock file appears to be held by a dead process.\n   206    /// This is informational only - use tryAcquireBreakingStale to actually acquire.\n   207    pub fn isStale(path: []const u8) bool {\n   208        const file = openOrCreateLockFile(path) catch return false;\n   209        defer file.close();\n   210\n   211        // Try to get lock - if we can, it's not held at all\n   212        const locked = tryLockExclusive(file) catch return false;\n   213        if (locked) {\n   214            unlock(file) catch {};\n   215            return false; // Not held, so not stale\n   216        }\n   217\n   218        // Lock is held - check if holder is alive\n   219        if (readPidFromLockFile(file)) |holder_pid| {\n   220            return !isProcessAlive(holder_pid);\n   221        }\n   222\n   223        // Can't determine PID, assume not stale\n   224        return false;\n   225    }\n   226\n   227    /// Get the PID of the current lock holder, if available.\n   228    pub fn getHolderPid(path: []const u8) ?i32 {\n   229        const file = openOrCreateLockFile(path) catch return null;\n   230        defer file.close();\n   231        return readPidFromLockFile(file);\n   232    }\n   233\n   234    /// Release the lock.\n   235    pub fn release(self: *Self) void {\n   236        // Record hold time metrics\n   237        if (self.acquire_time != 0) {\n   238            const now = std.time.nanoTimestamp();\n   239            const hold_ns: u64 = @intCast(@max(0, now - self.acquire_time));\n   240            metrics.recordRelease(hold_ns);\n   241        }\n   242\n   243        // Clear PID before releasing (optional, but clean)\n   244        self.file.seekTo(0) catch {};\n   245        self.file.setEndPos(0) catch {};\n   246\n   247        unlock(self.file) catch {};\n   248        self.file.close();\n   249    }\n   250\n   251    /// Deinitialize and release lock.\n   252    pub fn deinit(self: *Self) void {\n   253        self.release();\n   254    }\n   255};\n   256\n   257/// Execute a function while holding the beads lock.\n   258/// Provides RAII-style lock management.\n   259pub fn withLock(path: []const u8, comptime func: fn () anyerror!void) !void {\n   260    var lock = try BeadsLock.acquire(path);\n   261    defer lock.release();\n   262    return func();\n   263}\n   264\n   265/// Execute a function with context while holding the beads lock.\n   266pub fn withLockContext(\n   267    path: []const u8,\n   268    context: anytype,\n   269    comptime func: fn (@TypeOf(context)) anyerror!void,\n   270) !void {\n   271    var lock = try BeadsLock.acquire(path);\n   272    defer lock.release();\n   273    return func(context);\n   274}\n   275\n   276// Platform-specific implementations\n   277\n   278fn openOrCreateLockFile(path: []const u8) !std.fs.File {\n   279    const dir = std.fs.cwd();\n   280\n   281    // Ensure parent directory exists\n   282    if (std.fs.path.dirname(path)) |parent| {\n   283        dir.makePath(parent) catch |err| switch (err) {\n   284            error.PathAlreadyExists => {},\n   285            else => return err,\n   286        };\n   287    }\n   288\n   289    // Open or create the lock file\n   290    return dir.createFile(path, .{\n   291        .read = true,\n   292        .truncate = false,\n   293        .lock = .none, // We handle locking separately\n   294    });\n   295}\n   296\n   297fn lockExclusive(file: std.fs.File) !void {\n   298    if (builtin.os.tag == .windows) {\n   299        try lockExclusiveWindows(file);\n   300    } else {\n   301        try lockExclusivePosix(file);\n   302    }\n   303}\n   304\n   305fn tryLockExclusive(file: std.fs.File) !bool {\n   306    if (builtin.os.tag == .windows) {\n   307        return tryLockExclusiveWindows(file);\n   308    } else {\n   309        return tryLockExclusivePosix(file);\n   310    }\n   311}\n   312\n   313fn unlock(file: std.fs.File) !void {\n   314    if (builtin.os.tag == .windows) {\n   315        try unlockWindows(file);\n   316    } else {\n   317        try unlockPosix(file);\n   318    }\n   319}\n   320\n   321// POSIX implementation using flock\n   322fn lockExclusivePosix(file: std.fs.File) !void {\n   323    std.posix.flock(file.handle, std.posix.LOCK.EX) catch {\n   324        return error.LockFailed;\n   325    };\n   326}\n   327\n   328fn tryLockExclusivePosix(file: std.fs.File) !bool {\n   329    std.posix.flock(file.handle, std.posix.LOCK.EX | std.posix.LOCK.NB) catch |err| {\n   330        // EWOULDBLOCK means lock is held by another process\n   331        if (err == error.WouldBlock) {\n   332            return false;\n   333        }\n   334        return error.LockFailed;\n   335    };\n   336    return true;\n   337}\n   338\n   339fn unlockPosix(file: std.fs.File) !void {\n   340    std.posix.flock(file.handle, std.posix.LOCK.UN) catch {\n   341        return error.UnlockFailed;\n   342    };\n   343}\n   344\n   345// Windows implementation using LockFileEx\n   346const LOCKFILE_EXCLUSIVE_LOCK: u32 = 0x00000002;\n   347const LOCKFILE_FAIL_IMMEDIATELY: u32 = 0x00000001;\n   348\n   349fn lockExclusiveWindows(file: std.fs.File) !void {\n   350    const windows = std.os.windows;\n   351    var overlapped: windows.OVERLAPPED = std.mem.zeroes(windows.OVERLAPPED);\n   352\n   353    const result = windows.kernel32.LockFileEx(\n   354        file.handle,\n   355        LOCKFILE_EXCLUSIVE_LOCK,\n   356        0, // reserved\n   357        1, // bytes to lock low\n   358        0, // bytes to lock high\n   359        &overlapped,\n   360    );\n   361\n   362    if (result == 0) {\n   363        return error.LockFailed;\n   364    }\n   365}\n   366\n   367fn tryLockExclusiveWindows(file: std.fs.File) !bool {\n   368    const windows = std.os.windows;\n   369    var overlapped: windows.OVERLAPPED = std.mem.zeroes(windows.OVERLAPPED);\n   370\n   371    const result = windows.kernel32.LockFileEx(\n   372        file.handle,\n   373        LOCKFILE_EXCLUSIVE_LOCK | LOCKFILE_FAIL_IMMEDIATELY,\n   374        0, // reserved\n   375        1, // bytes to lock low\n   376        0, // bytes to lock high\n   377        &overlapped,\n   378    );\n   379\n   380    if (result == 0) {\n   381        const err = windows.kernel32.GetLastError();\n   382        if (err == windows.Win32Error.ERROR_LOCK_VIOLATION) {\n   383            return false;\n   384        }\n   385        return error.LockFailed;\n   386    }\n   387    return true;\n   388}\n   389\n   390fn unlockWindows(file: std.fs.File) !void {\n   391    const windows = std.os.windows;\n   392    var overlapped: windows.OVERLAPPED = std.mem.zeroes(windows.OVERLAPPED);\n   393\n   394    const result = windows.kernel32.UnlockFileEx(\n   395        file.handle,\n   396        0, // reserved\n   397        1, // bytes to unlock low\n   398        0, // bytes to unlock high\n   399        &overlapped,\n   400    );\n   401\n   402    if (result == 0) {\n   403        return error.UnlockFailed;\n   404    }\n release() is called.\n    pub fn acquire(path: []const u8) LockError!Self {\n        return acquireWithStaleLockDetection(path, DEFAULT_STALE_TIMEOUT_MS);\n    }\n\n    /// Acquire exclusive lock with stale lock detection and timeout.\n    /// If the lock holder process is dead, the lock is broken and acquired.\n    /// Returns error.LockTimeout if timeout_ms elapses without acquiring.\n    pub fn acquireWithStaleLockDetection(path: []const u8, timeout_ms: u64) LockError!Self {\n        const start_ns = std.time.nanoTimestamp();\n        var had_contention = false;\n        var broke_stale = false;\n\n        const file = openOrCreateLockFile(path) catch return LockError.LockFailed;\n        errdefer file.close();\n\n        // Try non-blocking lock first\n        const locked = tryLockExclusive(file) catch return LockError.LockFailed;\n        if (locked) {\n            // Got the lock immediately - write our PID\n            writePidToLockFile(file) catch {};\n            const acquire_time = std.time.nanoTimestamp();\n            const wait_ns: u64 = @intCast(@max(0, acquire_time - start_ns));\n            metrics.recordAcquisition(wait_ns, false);\n            return .{ .file = file, .path = path, .acquire_time = acquire_time };\n        }\n\n        // Lock is held - we have contention\n        had_contention = true;\n\n        // Check if holder is alive\n us the lock since the holder is gone\n                lockExclusive(file) catch return LockError.LockFailed;\n                writePidToLockFile(file) catch {};\n                broke_stale = true;\n                metrics.recordStaleLockBroken();\n                const acquire_time = std.time.nanoTimestamp();\n                const wait_ns: u64 = @intCast(@max(0, acquire_time - start_ns));\n                metrics.recordAcquisition(wait_ns, had_contention);\n                return .{ .file = file, .path = path, .acquire_time = acquire_time };\n            }\n        }\n\n        // Holder is alive or PID unknown - wait with timeout\n        const start = std.time.milliTimestamp();\n        const deadline = start + @as(i64, @intCast(timeout_ms));\n\n        while (std.time.milliTimestamp() < deadline) {\n            const try_locked = tryLockExclusive(file) catch return LockError.LockFailed;\n            if (try_locked) {\n                writePidToLockFile(file) catch {};\n had_contention);\n                if (broke_stale) metrics.recordStaleLockBroken();\n                return .{ .file = file, .path = path, .acquire_time = acquire_time };\n            }\n\n            // Check if holder died while we were waiting\n            if (readPidFromLockFile(file)) |holder_pid| {\n                if (!isProcessAlive(holder_pid)) {\n                    // Holder died - try to acquire\n                    const dead_locked = tryLockExclusive(file) catch return LockError.LockFailed;\n                    if (dead_locked) {\n                        writePidToLockFile(file) catch {};\n                        broke_stale = true;\n                        const acquire_time = std.time.nanoTimestamp();\n                        const wait_ns: u64 = @intCast(@max(0, acquire_time - start_ns));\n                        metrics.recordAcquisition(wait_ns, had_contention);\n                        metrics.recordStaleLockBroken();\n                        return .{ .file = file, .path = path, .acquire_time = acquire_time };\n                    }\n                }\n            }\n\n            // Sleep briefly before retrying\n            std.Thread.sleep(10 * std.time.ns_per_ms);\n        }\n\n        // Timeout\n        metrics.recordTimeout();\n        file.close();\n        return LockError.LockTimeout;\n    }\n\n    /// Try to acquire lock without blocking.\n    /// Returns null if lock is held by another process.\n    pub fn tryAcquire(path: []const u8) LockError!?Self {\n        const start_ns = std.time.nanoTimestamp();\n        const file = openOrCreateLockFile(path) catch return LockError.LockFailed;\n        errdefer file.close();\n\n        const locked = tryLockExclusive(file) catch return LockError.LockFailed;\n        if (!locked) std.time.nanoTimestamp();\n        const wait_ns: u64 = @intCast(@max(0, acquire_time - start_ns));\n        metrics.recordAcquisition(wait_ns, false);\n\n        return .{\n            .file = file,\n            .path = path,\n            .acquire_time = acquire_time,\n        };\n    }\n\n    /// Try to acquire lock, breaking stale locks from dead processes.\n    /// Returns null if lock is held by a live process.\n    pub fn tryAcquireBreakingStale(path: []const u8) LockError!?Self {\n        const start_ns = std.time.nanoTimestamp();\n        const file = openOrCreateLockFile(path) catch return LockError.LockFailed;\n        errdefer file.close();\n\n        const locked = tryLockExclusive(file) catch return LockError.LockFailed;\n        if (locked) {\n            writePidToLockFile(file) catch {};\n            const acquire_time = std.time.nanoTimestamp();\n            const wait_ns: u64 = @intCast(@max(0, acquire_time - start_ns));\n            metrics.recordAcquisition(wait_ns, false);\n            return .{ .file = file, .path = path, .acquire_time = acquire_time };\n        }\n\n        // Lock is held - check if holder is alive\n        if (readPidFromLockFile(file)) |holder_pid| {\n            if (!isProcessAlive(holder_pid)) {\n                // Holder is dead - force acquire\n                lockExclusive(file) catch return LockError.LockFailed;\n                writePidToLockFile(file) catch {};\n                metrics.recordStaleLockBroken();\n                const acquire_time = std.time.nanoTimestamp();\n                const wait_ns: u64 = @intCast(@max(0, acquire_time - start_ns));\n                metrics.recordAcquisition(wait_ns, true); // Contention (had to break stale)\n                return .{ .file = file, .path = path, .acquire_time = acquire_time };\n            }\n        }\n\n        // Holder is alive\n        file.close();\n        return null;\n    }\n\n    /// Acquire with timeout (in milliseconds).\n    /// Returns null if lock could not be acquired within timeout.\n    /// DEPRECATED: Use acquireWithStaleLockDetection instead for better stale lock handling.\n    pub fn acquireTimeout(path: []const u8, timeout_ms: u64) LockError!?Self {\n        const result = acquireWithStaleLockDetection(path, timeout_ms) catch |err| {\n            if (err == LockError.LockTimeout) {\n                return null;\n            }\n            return err;\n        };\n        return result;\n    }\n\n    /// Check if this lock file appears to be held by a dead process.\n    /// defer file.close();\n\n        // Try to get lock - if we can, it's not held at all\n        const locked = tryLockExclusive(file) catch return false;\n        if (locked) {\n            unlock(file) catch {};\n            return false; // Not held, so not stale\n        }\n\n        // Lock is held - check if holder is alive\n        if (readPidFromLockFile(file)) |holder_pid| {\n pub fn getHolderPid(path: []const u8) ?i32 {\n        const file = openOrCreateLockFile(path) catch return null;\n        defer file.close();\n        return readPidFromLockFile(file);\n    }\n\n    /// Release the lock.\n    pub fn release(self: *Self) void {\n        // Record hold time metrics\n        if (self.acquire_time != 0) {\n            const now = std.time.nanoTimestamp();\n self.file.seekTo(0) catch {};\n        self.file.setEndPos(0) catch {};\n\n        unlock(self.file) catch {};\n        self.file.close();\n    }\n\n    /// Deinitialize and release lock.\n    pub fn windows.kernel32.LockFileEx(\n        file.handle,\n        LOCKFILE_EXCLUSIVE_LOCK | LOCKFILE_FAIL_IMMEDIATELY,\n        0, // reserved\n        1, // bytes to lock low\n        0, // bytes to lock Lock is blocking by default, with optional timeout.\n\nconst std = @import(\"std\");\nconst builtin = @import(\"builtin\");\nconst test_util = @import(\"../test_util.zig\");\nconst metrics = @import(\"metrics.zig\");\nconst txlog = @import(\"txlog.zig\");\n\npub const LockError = error{\n    LockFailed,\n    LockTimeout,\n    FileNotFound,\n    AccessDenied,\n    Unexpected,\n    StaleLockBroken,\n};\n\npub const BeadsLock = struct {\n    file: std.fs.File,\n    path: []const u8,\n    acquire_time: i128 = 0, // Timestamp when lock was acquired (for hold time tracking)\n    correlation_id: u64 = 0, // Transaction correlation ID for logging\n\n    const Self = @This();\n\n    /// Default timeout for stale lock detection (30 seconds).\n    pub const DEFAULT_STALE_TIMEOUT_MS: u64 = 30_000;\n\n    /// Acquire exclusive lock. Blocks until available.\n    /// If the lock is held by a dead process, breaks the stale lock.\n    /// The lock is automatically released when the BeadsLock is deinitialized\n    /// or when release() is called.\n    pub fn acquire(path: []const u8) LockError!Self {\n        return acquireWithStaleLockDetection(path, DEFAULT_STALE_TIMEOUT_MS);\n    }\n\n    /// Acquire exclusive lock with stale lock detection and timeout.\n    /// If the lock holder process is dead, the lock is broken and acquired.\n    /// Returns error.LockTimeout if timeout_ms elapses without acquiring.\n    pub fn acquireWithStaleLockDetection(path: []const u8, timeout_ms: u64) LockError!Self {\n        const start_ns = std.time.nanoTimestamp();\n        var had_contention = false;\n        var broke_stale = false;\n\n        const file = openOrCreateLockFile(path) catch return LockError.LockFailed;\n        errdefer file.close();\n\n        // Try non-blocking lock first\n        const locked = tryLockExclusive(file) catch return LockError.LockFailed;\n        if (locked) {\n            // Got the lock immediately - write our PID\n            writePidToLockFile(file) catch {};\n            const acquire_time = std.time.nanoTimestamp();\n            const wait_ns: u64 = @intCast(@max(0, acquire_time - start_ns));\n            metrics.recordAcquisition(wait_ns, false);\n            return .{ .file = file, .path = path, .acquire_time = acquire_time };\n        }\n\n        // Lock is held - we have contention\n        had_contention = true;\n\n        // Check if holder is alive\n        if (readPidFromLockFile(file)) |holder_pid| {\n            if (!isProcessAlive(holder_pid)) {\n                // Holder is dead - force acquire by blocking\n                // The kernel will grant us the lock since the holder is gone\n                lockExclusive(file) catch return LockError.LockFailed;\n                writePidToLockFile(file) catch {};\n                broke_stale = true;\n          metrics.recordAcquisition(wait_ns, had_contention);\n                return .{ .file = file, .path = path, .acquire_time = acquire_time };\n            }\n        }\n\n        // Holder is alive or PID unknown - wait with timeout\n        const start = std.time.milliTimestamp();\n        const deadline = start + @as(i64, @intCast(timeout_ms));\n\n        while (std.time.milliTimestamp() < deadline) {\n            const try_locked = tryLockExclusive(file) catch return LockError.LockFailed;\n            if (try_locked) {\n                writePidToLockFile(file) catch {};\n                const acquire_time = std.time.nanoTimestamp();\n                const wait_ns: u64 = @intCast(@max(0, acquire_time - start_ns));\n                metrics.recordAcquisition(wait_ns, had_contention);\n                if (broke_stale) metrics.recordStaleLockBroken();\n                return .{ .file = file, .path = path, .acquire_time = acquire_time };\n            }\n\n            // Check if holder died while we were waiting\n            if (readPidFromLockFile(file)) |holder_pid| {\n                if (!isProcessAlive(holder_pid)) {\n                    // Holder died - try to acquire\n                    const dead_locked = tryLockExclusive(file) catch return LockError.LockFailed;\n                    if (dead_locked) {\n                        writePidToLockFile(file) catch {};\n                        broke_stale = true;\n                        const acquire_time = std.time.nanoTimestamp();\n                        const wait_ns: u64 = @intCast(@max(0, acquire_time - start_ns));\n                        metrics.recordAcquisition(wait_ns, had_contention);\n                        metrics.recordStaleLockBroken();\n                        return .{ blocking.\n    /// Returns null if lock is held by another process.\n    pub fn tryAcquire(path: []const u8) LockError!?Self {\n        const start_ns = std.time.nanoTimestamp();\n        const file = LockError.LockFailed;\n                writePidToLockFile(file) catch {};\n                metrics.recordStaleLockBroken();\n                const acquire_time = std.time.nanoTimestamp();\n                const wait_ns: u64 = @intCast(@max(0, acquire_time - start_ns));\n                metrics.recordAcquisition(wait_ns, true); // Contention (had to break stale)\n                return .{ .file = {\n                return null;\n            }\n            return err;\n        };\n        return result;\n    }\n\n    /// Check if this lock file appears to be held by a dead process.\n    /// defer file.close();\n\n        // Try to get lock - if we can, it's not held at all\n        const locked = tryLockExclusive(file) catch return false;\n        if (locked) {\n            unlock(file) catch {};\n            return false; // Not held, so not stale\n        }\n\n        // Lock is held - check if holder is alive\n        if (readPidFromLockFile(file)) |holder_pid| {\n            return !isProcessAlive(holder_pid);\n        }\n\n        // Can't determine PID, assume not stale\n        return false;\n    }\n\n    /// Get the PID of the current lock holder, if available.\n    pub fn getHolderPid(path: []const u8) ?i32 {\n        const file = openOrCreateLockFile(path) catch return null;\n        defer file.close();\n        return readPidFromLockFile(file);\n    }\n\n    /// Release the lock.\n    pub fn release(self: *Self) void {\n        // Record hold time metrics\n        if (self.acquire_time != 0) {\n            const now = std.time.nanoTimestamp();\n            const hold_ns: u64 = @intCast(@max(0, now - self.acquire_time));\n            metrics.recordRelease(hold_ns);\n        }\n\n        // Clear PID before releasing (optional, but clean)\n        self.file.seekTo(0) catch {};\n        self.file.setEndPos(0) catch {};\n\n        unlock(self.file) catch {};\n        self.file.close();\n    }\n\n    /// Deinitialize and release lock.\n    pub fn deinit(self: *Self) void {\n        self.release();\n    }\n};\n\n/// Execute a function while holding the beads lock.\n/// Provides RAII-style lock management.\npub fn withLock(path: []const u8, defer lock.release();\n    return func(context);\n}\n\n// Platform-specific implementations\n\nfn openOrCreateLockFile(path: []const u8) !std.fs.File {\n    const dir = std.fs.cwd();\n\n    // Ensure parent directory exists\n    if (std.fs.path.dirname(path)) |parent| {\n        dir.makePath(parent) catch |err| switch (err) {\n            error.PathAlreadyExists => {},\n            else => return lockExclusivePosix(file);\n    }\n}\n\nfn tryLockExclusive(file: std.fs.File) !bool {\n    if (builtin.os.tag == .windows) {\n        return tryLockExclusiveWindows(file);\n    } else {\n        return tryLockExclusivePosix(file);\n    }\n}\n\nfn unlock(file: std.fs.File) !void {\n    if (builtin.os.tag == .windows) {\n        try unlockWindows(file);\n    } else {\n        try error.LockFailed;\n    };\n}\n\nfn tryLockExclusivePosix(file: std.fs.File) !bool {\n    std.posix.flock(file.handle, std.posix.LOCK.EX | std.posix.LOCK.NB) catch |err| {\n        // EWOULDBLOCK means windows.kernel32.LockFileEx(\n        file.handle,\n        LOCKFILE_EXCLUSIVE_LOCK | LOCKFILE_FAIL_IMMEDIATELY,\n        0, // reserved\n        1, // bytes to lock low\n        0, // bytes to lock Lock is blocking by default, with optional timeout.\n\nconst std = @import(\"std\");\nconst builtin = @import(\"builtin\");\nconst test_util = @import(\"../test_util.zig\");\nconst metrics = @import(\"metrics.zig\");\n\npub const LockError = error{\n    LockFailed,\n    LockTimeout,\n    FileNotFound,\n    AccessDenied,\n    Unexpected,\n    StaleLockBroken,\n};\n\npub const BeadsLock = struct {\n    file: std.fs.File,\n    path: []const u8,\n    acquire_time: i128 = 0, // Timestamp when lock was acquired (for hold time tracking)\n    correlation_id: u64 = 0, // Transaction correlation ID for logging\n\n    const Self = @This();\n\n    /// Default timeout for stale lock detection (30 seconds).\n    pub const DEFAULT_STALE_TIMEOUT_MS: u64 = 30_000;\n\n    /// Acquire exclusive lock. release() is called.\n    pub fn acquire(path: []const u8) LockError!Self {\n        return acquireWithStaleLockDetection(path, DEFAULT_STALE_TIMEOUT_MS);\n    }\n\n    /// Acquire exclusive lock with stale lock detection and timeout.\n    /// If the lock holder process is dead, the lock is broken and acquired.\n    /// Returns error.LockTimeout if timeout_ms elapses without acquiring.\n    pub fn acquireWithStaleLockDetection(path: []const u8, timeout_ms: u64) LockError!Self {\n        const start_ns = std.time.nanoTimestamp();\n        var had_contention = false;\n        var broke_stale = false;\n\n        const file = openOrCreateLockFile(path) catch return LockError.LockFailed;\n        errdefer file.close();\n\n        // Try non-blocking lock first\n        const locked = tryLockExclusive(file) catch return LockError.LockFailed;\n        if (locked) {\n            // Got the lock immediately - write our PID\n            writePidToLockFile(file) catch {};\n            const acquire_time = std.time.nanoTimestamp();\n            const wait_ns: u64 = @intCast(@max(0, acquire_time - start_ns));\n            metrics.recordAcquisition(wait_ns, false);\n            return .{ .file = file, .path = path, .acquire_time = acquire_time };\n        }\n\n        // Lock is held - we have contention\n        had_contention = true;\n\n        // Check if holder is alive\n        if (readPidFromLockFile(file)) |holder_pid| {\n            if (!isProcessAlive(holder_pid)) {\n                // Holder is dead - force acquire by blocking\n                // The kernel will grant us the lock since the holder is gone\n                lockExclusive(file) catch return LockError.LockFailed;\n                writePidToLockFile(file) catch {};\n                broke_stale = true;\n                metrics.recordStaleLockBroken();\n                const acquire_time = std.time.nanoTimestamp();\n                const wait_ns: u64 = @intCast(@max(0, acquire_time - start_ns));\n                metrics.recordAcquisition(wait_ns, had_contention);\n                return .{ .file = file, .path = path, .acquire_time = acquire_time };\n            }\n        }\n\n        // Holder is alive or PID unknown - wait with timeout\n        const start = std.time.milliTimestamp();\n        const deadline = start + @as(i64, @intCast(timeout_ms));\n\n        while (std.time.milliTimestamp() < deadline) {\n            const try_locked = tryLockExclusive(file) catch return LockError.LockFailed;\n            if (try_locked) {\n                writePidToLockFile(file) catch {};\n had_contention);\n                if (broke_stale) metrics.recordStaleLockBroken();\n                return .{ .file = file, .path = path, .acquire_time = acquire_time };\n            }\n\n            // Check if holder died while we were waiting\n            if (readPidFromLockFile(file)) |holder_pid| {\n                if (!isProcessAlive(holder_pid)) {\n                    // Holder died - try to acquire\n                    const dead_locked = tryLockExclusive(file) catch return LockError.LockFailed;\n                    if (dead_locked) {\n                        writePidToLockFile(file)     const wait_ns: u64 = @intCast(@max(0, acquire_time - start_ns));\n                metrics.recordAcquisition(wait_ns, true); // Contention (had to break stale)\n                return .{ .file = milliseconds).\n    /// Returns null if lock could not be acquired within timeout.\n    /// DEPRECATED: Use acquireWithStaleLockDetection instead for better stale lock handling.\n    pub fn acquireTimeout(path: []const u8, timeout_ms: u64) LockError!?Self {\n        const result = acquireWithStaleLockDetection(path, timeout_ms) catch |err| {\n            if (err == LockError.LockTimeout) {\n                return null;\n            }\n            return err;\n        };\n        return result;\n    }\n\n    /// Check if this lock file appears to be held by a dead process.\n    /// This is informational only - use tryAcquireBreakingStale to actually acquire.\n    pub fn isStale(path: []const u8) bool {\n        const file = openOrCreateLockFile(path) catch return false;\n        defer file.close();\n\n        // Try to get lock - if we can, it's not held at all\n        const locked = tryLockExclusive(file) catch return false;\n        if (locked) {\n            unlock(file) catch {};\n            return false; // Not held, so not stale\n        }\n\n        // Lock is held - check if holder is alive\n        if (readPidFromLockFile(file)) |holder_pid| {\n            return !isProcessAlive(holder_pid);\n        }\n\n        // Can't determine PID, assume not stale\n        return false;\n    }\n\n    /// Get the PID of the current lock holder, if available.\n    pub fn getHolderPid(path: []const u8) ?i32 {\n        const file = openOrCreateLockFile(path) catch return null;\n        defer file.close();\n        return readPidFromLockFile(file);\n    }\n\n    /// Release the lock.\n    pub fn release(self: *Self) void {\n        // Record hold time metrics\n        if (self.acquire_time != 0) {\n            const now = std.time.nanoTimestamp();\n            const hold_ns: u64 = @intCast(@max(0, now - self.acquire_time));\n            metrics.recordRelease(hold_ns);\n        }\n\n        // Clear PID before releasing (optional, but clean)\n        self.file.seekTo(0) catch {};\n        self.file.setEndPos(0) catch {};\n\n        unlock(self.file) catch {};\n        self.file.close();\n    }\n\n    /// Deinitialize and release lock.\n    pub fn deinit(self: *Self) void {\n        self.release();\n    }\n};\n\n/// Execute a function while holding the beads lock.\n/// Provides RAII-style lock management.\npub fn withLock(path: []const u8, defer lock.release();\n    return func(context);\n}\n\n// Platform-specific implementations\n\nfn openOrCreateLockFile(path: []const u8) !std.fs.File {\n    const dir = std.fs.cwd();\n\n    // Ensure return tryLockExclusivePosix(file);\n    }\n}\n\nfn unlock(file: std.fs.File) !void {\n    if (builtin.os.tag == .windows) {\n        try unlockWindows(file);\n    } else {\n        try Lock contention and transaction metrics for beads_zig.\n//!\n//! Tracks lock acquisition statistics for debugging concurrency issues\n//! in multi-agent scenarios. Metrics are process-local (not persisted).\n//!\n//! Usage:\n//!   - Metrics are accumulated in a global atomic struct\n//!   - Use getMetrics() to read current values\n//!   - Use resetMetrics() to clear counters\n//!   - The `bz metrics` command reports these statistics\n\nconst std = @import(\"std\");\nconst builtin = @import(\"builtin\");\n\n/// Lock contention metrics.\n/// All fields are atomic for safe concurrent access.\npub const LockMetrics = struct {\n    /// Total number of lock acquisitions (successful).\n    lock_acquisitions: u64 = 0,\n    /// Total nanoseconds spent waiting for locks.\n    lock_wait_total_ns: u64 = 0,\n    /// Total nanoseconds locks were held.\n    lock_hold_total_ns: u64 = 0,\n    /// Number of times lock acquisition had to wait (contention).\n    lock_contentions: u64 = 0,\n    /// Maximum wait time observed (nanoseconds).\n    max_wait_ns: u64 = 0,\n    /// Maximum hold time observed (nanoseconds).\n    max_hold_ns: u64 = 0,\n    /// Number of lock timeouts.\n    lock_timeouts: u64 = 0,\n    /// Number of stale locks broken.\n    stale_locks_broken: u64 = 0,\n\n    /// Calculate average wait time in nanoseconds.\n    pub fn avgWaitNs(self: LockMetrics) u64 {\n        if (self.lock_acquisitions == 0) return 0;\n        return self.lock_wait_total_ns / self.lock_acquisitions;\n    }\n\n    /// Calculate average hold time in nanoseconds.\n    pub fn avgHoldNs(self: LockMetrics) u64 {\n        if (self.lock_acquisitions == 0) return 0;\n        return self.lock_hold_total_ns / self.lock_acquisitions;\n    }\n\n    /// Calculate contention rate as percentage (0-100).\n    pub fn contentionRate(self: LockMetrics) f64 {\n        if (self.lock_acquisitions == 0) return 0.0;\n        return (@as(f64, @floatFromInt(self.lock_contentions)) / @as(f64, @floatFromInt(self.lock_acquisitions))) * 100.0;\n    }\n\n    /// Convert nanoseconds to milliseconds (floating point).\n    pub fn nsToMs(ns: u64) f64 {\n        return @as(f64, @floatFromInt(ns)) / 1_000_000.0;\n    }\n\n    /// Format metrics as human-readable string.\n    pub fn format(self: LockMetrics, allocator: std.mem.Allocator) ![]u8 {\n        return std.fmt.allocPrint(allocator,\n            \\\\Lock Contention Metrics\n            \\\\-----------------------\n            \\\\Acquisitions:     {d}\n            \\\\Contentions:      {d} ({d:.1}%)\n            \\\\Timeouts:         {d}\n            \\\\Stale locks:      {d}\n            \\\\\n            \\\\Wait time (total): {d:.2} ms\n            \\\\Wait time (avg):   {d:.3} ms\n            \\\\Wait time (max):   {d:.3} ms\n            \\\\\n            \\\\Hold time (total): {d:.2} ms\n            \\\\Hold time (avg):   {d:.3} ms\n            \\\\Hold time (max):   {d:.3} ms\n        , .{\n            self.lock_acquisitions,\n            self.lock_contentions,\n            self.contentionRate(),\n            self.lock_timeouts,\n            self.stale_locks_broken,\n            nsToMs(self.lock_wait_total_ns),\n            nsToMs(self.avgWaitNs()),\n            nsToMs(self.max_wait_ns),\n            nsToMs(self.lock_hold_total_ns),\n            nsToMs(self.avgHoldNs()),\n            nsToMs(self.max_hold_ns),\n        });\n    }\n\n    /// Convert to JSON-serializable struct.\n    pub fn toJson(self: LockMetrics) JsonMetrics {\n        return .{\n            .lock_acquisitions = self.lock_acquisitions,\n            .lock_contentions = self.lock_contentions,\n            .lock_timeouts = self.lock_timeouts,\n            .stale_locks_broken = self.stale_locks_broken,\n            .lock_wait_total_ms = nsToMs(self.lock_wait_total_ns),\n            .lock_wait_avg_ms = nsToMs(self.avgWaitNs()),\n            .lock_wait_max_ms = nsToMs(self.max_wait_ns),\n            .lock_hold_total_ms = nsToMs(self.lock_hold_total_ns),\n            .lock_hold_avg_ms = nsToMs(self.avgHoldNs()),\n            .lock_hold_max_ms = nsToMs(self.max_hold_ns),\n            .contention_rate_percent = self.contentionRate(),\n        };\n    }\n};\n\n/// JSON-friendly metrics structure for --json output.\npub const JsonMetrics = struct {\n    lock_acquisitions: u64,\n    lock_contentions: u64,\n    lock_timeouts: u64,\n    stale_locks_broken: u64,\n    lock_wait_total_ms: f64,\n    lock_wait_avg_ms: f64,\n .{\n        .name = \"changelog\",\n        .summary = \"Generate changelog from closed issues\",\n        .usage = \"bz changelog [--since DATE] [--until DATE] [--limit N] [--group-by FIELD]\",\n (YYYY-MM-DD)\" },\n            .{ .short = \"-n\", .long = \"--limit\", .arg = \"N\", .description = \"Maximum entries\" },\n            .{ .short = \"-g\", .long = \"--group-by\", .arg = \"FIELD\", .description = \"Group by field (e.g., type)\" },\n        },\n        .examples = &[_]ExampleHelp{\n            .{ .command = \"bz changelog\", .description = \"Generate changelog\" },\n            .{ .command = \"bz changelog --since 2024-01-01\", .description = \"Since specific date\" },\n            .{ .command = \"bz changelog --group-by type\", .description = \"Group by issue type\" },\n        },\n        .see_also = &[_][]const u8{\"audit\"},\n    },\n\n    // System commands\n    .{\n        .name = \"version\",\n        .summary = \"Show version\",\n        .usage = \"bz version\",\n .command = \"bz completions fish > ~/.config/fish/completions/bz.fish\", .description = \"Install fish completions\" },\n        },\n    },\n    .{\n        .name = \"help\",\n        .summary =
